author: Euan McKirdy, CNN
description: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte is soon to depart on an official visit Moscow as part of the Asian nation's pivot away from the United States
title: Philippines' Duterte looks to strengthen ties with trip to Moscow

author: The Associated Press
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte declared the country's south under martial rule for 60 days.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in south Philippines amid deadly clashes

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte warned Wednesday that he'll be harsh in enforcing martial law in his country's south as he abruptly left Moscow to deal with a crisis at home sparked by a Muslim extremist siege on a city, where militants burned buildings overnight and are feared to have taken hostages. Duterte declared martial rule for 60 days in the entire southern Mindanao region, the restive third of the Philippine archipelago, Tuesday evening to try to crush Muslim extremists who have aligned themselves with the Islamic State group and occupied a hospital, jail and other buildings and battled troops in an audacious attack in Marawi City.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in besieged south Philippines

author: Reuters
description: Duterte said Xi had warned him there would be war if the Philippines tried to explore for oil in the South China Sea.
title: The Philippines is starting up damage control after Duterte claims China threatened war

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Islamic State group-linked militants swept through a southern Philippine city, beheading a police chief, burning buildings, seizing a Catholic priest and his worshippers and raising the black flag of IS, authorities said Wednesday. President Rodrigo Duterte, who had declared martial law across the southern third of the nation, warned he may expand it nationwide. As details of the attack in Marawi city emerged, fears mounted that the largest Roman Catholic nation in Asia could be falling into a growing list of countries grappling with the spread of influence from the Islamic State group in Syria and Iraq.
title: Islamic State-linked militants besiege Philippine city

author: Romeo Ranoco
description: Thousands of civilians fled fighting in the Philippines on Wednesday as troops sought to contain Islamic State-linked militants who took over large parts of a city, set building ablaze and captured a Catholic priest and other Christians.
title: Defiant Duterte threatens harsh measures as thousands flee Philippines unrest

description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte warned Wednesday that he’ll be harsh in enforcing martial law in his country’s south as he abruptly left Moscow to deal with a crisis at home sparked by a Muslim extremist siege on a city, where militants burned buildings overnight and are feared to have taken hostages.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in besieged south Philippines

author: Jake Maxwell Watts
description: The Philippines President said his Chinese counterpart had threatened him that Beijing would “go to war” if Manila begins drilling for oil in the South China Sea.
title: Philippines’ Duterte Says Chinese Leader Raised Threat of War Over South China Sea

author: Euan McKirdy and Joshua Berlinger, CNN
description: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte said his martial law declaration for the country's restive south was necessary in order to fight militants there.
title: Duterte: 'I had to declare martial law' to fight ISIS in Mindanao

description: The Latest on the siege of a Philippine city that led President Rodrigo Duterte to declare martial law in the south (all times local):
title: The Latest: Duterte considering nationwide martial law
